what: ElectricVehiclesR: Exploring Electric Vehicle Data in Washington State
title: ElectricVehiclesR Package
text: ElectricVehiclesR package designed provide comprehensive insights electric vehicle (EV) adoption trends Washington State, USA. leverages extensive dataset registered electric vehicles, offering tools filter, summarize, visualize EV data. package particularly useful analysts, researchers, policymakers interested understanding growth electric plug-hybrid vehicles region.

title: ElectricVehiclesR Package
text: ElectricVehiclesR package includes several datasets functions aimed streamlining analysis electric vehicle data: cities - dataset contains names cities electric vehicles registered. serves useful reference mapping analysis city level. clean_vehicle - primary dataset, providing detailed information electric vehicles registered Washington State. includes various attributes vehicle make, model, type, electric range, . dataset forms foundation analyses within package. filter_vehicles() - function allows users filter dataset based specific criteria, desired vehicle type, make, electric range. makes easy narrow data specific subset aligns user preferences, aiding targeted analyses. grid_counts_simplified - dataset provides simplified grid counts, particularly useful creating visualizations Leaflet package. helps users create clean efficient map plots, improving performance mapping large datasets vehicle locations. load_app() - function launches interactive Shiny application included package. Shiny app allows users interactively explore electric vehicle dataset, apply filters, visualize trends dynamic charts maps. summary_filtered_data() - function summarizes filtered dataset, providing key metrics insights based selected subset data. can used quickly understand characteristics distribution filtered electric vehicles, counts make, type, range.

title: ElectricVehiclesR Package
code: # Load dataset  data(clean_vehicle) # Filter for electric range between 150 and 300, make 'Tesla', and vehicle type 'BEV' filtered_data <- filter_vehicles(   data = clean_vehicle,   mileage_range = c(0, 500),   car_make = "TESLA",   vehicle_type = "Battery Electric Vehicle (BEV)" )  head(filtered_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   county    city  state postal_code model_year make  model electric_vehicle_type #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>       <dbl>      <int> <chr> <chr> <chr>                 #> 1 Thurston  Lacey WA          98516       2017 TESLA MODE… Battery Electric Veh… #> 2 Yakima    Yaki… WA          98902       2020 TESLA MODE… Battery Electric Veh… #> 3 Snohomish Moun… WA          98043       2020 TESLA MODE… Battery Electric Veh… #> 4 King      Seat… WA          98121       2015 TESLA MODE… Battery Electric Veh… #> 5 Yakima    Moxee WA          98936       2020 TESLA MODE… Battery Electric Veh… #> 6 Snohomish Wood… WA          98077       2017 TESLA MODE… Battery Electric Veh… #> # ℹ 5 more variables: clean_alternative_fuel_vehicle_cafv_eligibility <chr>, #> #   electric_range <int>, vehicle_location <chr>, lon <dbl>, lat <dbl>

title: ElectricVehiclesR Package
code: # Filter for electric range between 100 and 250, model years between 2018 and 2020 filtered_data <- filter_vehicles(   data = clean_vehicle,   mileage_range = c(100, 250),   year_range = c(2018, 2020) )  head(filtered_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 13 #>   county    city  state postal_code model_year make  model electric_vehicle_type #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>       <dbl>      <int> <chr> <chr> <chr>                 #> 1 Snohomish Both… WA          98021       2018 CHEV… BOLT… Battery Electric Veh… #> 2 Kitsap    Brem… WA          98310       2018 NISS… LEAF  Battery Electric Veh… #> 3 Snohomish Lynn… WA          98036       2018 TESLA MODE… Battery Electric Veh… #> 4 Kitsap    Brem… WA          98312       2020 KIA   NIRO  Battery Electric Veh… #> 5 Thurston  Olym… WA          98501       2018 NISS… LEAF  Battery Electric Veh… #> 6 King      Seat… WA          98117       2018 TESLA MODE… Battery Electric Veh… #> # ℹ 5 more variables: clean_alternative_fuel_vehicle_cafv_eligibility <chr>, #> #   electric_range <int>, vehicle_location <chr>, lon <dbl>, lat <dbl>

title: ElectricVehiclesR Package
code: # Using the filtered_data from the previous example summary_stats <- summary_filtered_data(filtered_data)  print(summary_stats) #> $avg_electric_range #> [1] 209.68 #>  #> $median_electric_range #> [1] 215 #>  #> $min_electric_range #> [1] 100 #>  #> $max_electric_range #> [1] 249 #>  #> $top_common_makes #> [1] "TESLA"     "NISSAN"    "CHEVROLET" #>  #> $vehicle_type_percentage #>  #>         Battery Electric Vehicle (BEV) Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicle (PHEV)  #>                                  99.57                                   0.43

title: ElectricVehiclesR Package
code: # Launch the Shiny app load_app()  # This will open the Shiny app in your default web browser, allowing you to  # explore the electric vehicle dataset interactively.

what: Examining Electric Vehicle Data in Washington State, USA.
title: Examining Electric Vehicle Data in Washington State, USA.
text: goal ElectricVehiclesR package study statistics behind electric vehicles State Washington United States America. RShiny app included within package provides interactivity user view various plots filter according test combinations criteria come upon personal electric vehicles options. can view -depth guide package website. NOTE: Upon launching RShiny app, may appear laggy, slow, plots may appearing. Please allow app approximately 15-30 seconds boot correctly. caused various large datasets app depends upon.

title: Examining Electric Vehicle Data in Washington State, USA.
text: can install development version ElectricVehiclesR GitHub :

title: Examining Electric Vehicle Data in Washington State, USA.
text: basic example shows produce plots main dataset clean_vehicle:
code: library(ElectricVehiclesR) library(tidyverse)  clean_vehicle |>   group_by(model_year) |>   summarize(average_range = mean(electric_range, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = model_year,               y = average_range)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Average Electric Range by Model Year",        x = "Model Year",        y = "Average Electric Range (miles)") +   theme_bw()

what: Filter Vehicles Based on User Preferences — filter_vehicles
title: Filter Vehicles Based on User Preferences — filter_vehicles
text: function filters dataset based user-selected electric range, car make, type vehicle, model year.

title: Filter Vehicles Based on User Preferences — filter_vehicles
code: filter_vehicles(   data,   mileage_range = c(0, 500),   car_make = NULL,   vehicle_type = NULL,   year_range = NULL )

title: Filter Vehicles Based on User Preferences — filter_vehicles
text: data dataset filter (dataframe). mileage_range numeric vector length 2 indicating range desired electric mileage. car_make character vector car makes include. vehicle_type character vector vehicle types include. year_range numeric vector length 2 indicating range desired model years.

title: Filter Vehicles Based on User Preferences — filter_vehicles
text: filtered dataframe based user's provided criteria.

title: Loading the Rshiny app — load_app
text: function launches RShiny app allows user explore Electric Vehicle data come upon conclusions.

title: Summarize Filtered Vehicle Data — summary_filtered_data
text: function provides comprehensive summary filtered dataset, including average, median, min, max electric range, common makes, vehicle type distribution percentages.

title: Summarize Filtered Vehicle Data — summary_filtered_data
text: data dataframe containing filtered vehicle data. include columns electric range, make, electric vehicle type.

title: Summarize Filtered Vehicle Data — summary_filtered_data
text: list following elements: avg_electric_range Average electric range across filtered dataset. median_electric_range Median electric range across filtered dataset. min_electric_range Minimum electric range filtered dataset. max_electric_range Maximum electric range filtered dataset. top_common_makes Vector top one three common vehicle makes filtered dataset. vehicle_type_percentage Named vector showing percentage distribution vehicle types.
